keyMoments.title: Sharinguru's Debut
keyMoments.description: Marine Captain Sharinguru appears for the first time, attacking Franky on the Bridge of Hesitation with a sword (instead of his Devil Fruit powers as shown in the manga).
keyMoments.significance: First appearance of this Marine captain who possesses the Shari Shari no Mi Devil Fruit.

keyMoments.title: Defeated by Franky
keyMoments.description: Despite attacking Franky, Sharinguru is quickly defeated in their brief confrontation.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Franky's combat strength even against Marine captains.

reveals.information: Possesses the Shari Shari no Mi (Wheel-Wheel Fruit), though it is not shown in the anime
Marine Captain participating in the Buster Call on Enies Lobby

name.japanese: ゴーイング・メリー号

keyMoments.title: Going Merry's Voice Calls to the Straw Hats
keyMoments.description: The Going Merry's Klabautermann speaks directly to all the Straw Hats for the first time, telling them to jump into the sea. Despite never hearing this voice before, each crew member recognizes it as their ship.
keyMoments.significance: First time the Going Merry's spirit directly communicates with the entire crew, confirming the ship's sentience.
keyMoments.quote: Jump into the sea! I'm here to save you!

keyMoments.title: Going Merry Appears to Rescue the Crew
keyMoments.description: The Going Merry appears below the jumping crew, having sailed from Water 7 to Enies Lobby completely autonomously. Despite being battered beyond repair, the ship's Klabautermann manifested to save the Straw Hats one final time.
keyMoments.significance: One of the most emotional moments in One Piece - the ship's autonomous journey demonstrates the profound bond between vessel and crew.
keyMoments.quote: I've come to take you all home!

keyMoments.title: Successfully Rescues All Straw Hats
keyMoments.description: All crew members land safely on the Going Merry's deck, escaping the Buster Call's cannon barrage.
keyMoments.significance: Completes the rescue mission and reunites the crew with their beloved ship for their final voyage together.

statusHistory.reason: Sailed to Enies Lobby while battered beyond repair

abilities.description: The Going Merry's ship spirit can speak and control the ship independently, sailing without a crew.
The Going Merry can sail itself from Water 7 to Enies Lobby through dangerous Grand Line waters without any crew aboard.

relationships.description: Usopp has the strongest connection to the Going Merry, being the first to recognize its voice and understand its spirit.

evolutionMoments.description: Usopp is the first to hear and recognize the Going Merry's voice, convincing the crew to trust in the ship.

reveals.information: The Going Merry's Klabautermann can speak directly to the crew and control the ship autonomously
The ship's spirit is strong enough to sail the Grand Line independently to rescue the crew

keyMoments.title: First to Recognize Going Merry's Voice
keyMoments.description: Usopp is the first to hear the Going Merry's voice and recognize it as their ship's spirit calling to them.
keyMoments.significance: Highlights Usopp's special connection to the Going Merry as the crew member most attuned to the ship.

keyMoments.title: Usopp Orders Everyone to Jump
keyMoments.description: Despite the apparent danger of jumping into the sea with three Devil Fruit users in the crew, Usopp convinces everyone to trust in the Going Merry and jump.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Usopp's growth as a leader and his unwavering faith in their ship.

relationships.description: Usopp has the deepest connection to the Going Merry among all crew members.

evolutionMoments.description: Usopp's bond with the Going Merry allows him to be the first to recognize its voice and spirit.

keyMoments.title: Uses Cien Fleur: Delphinium to Save Luffy
keyMoments.description: Robin uses her Devil Fruit ability 'Cien Fleur: Delphinium' to carry the immobilized Luffy off the column and toward the sea, protecting him from the cannon fire.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Robin's development from being the one who needed saving to being the one who protects others.

abilities.description: Robin creates one hundred arms to form a giant pair of wings that can carry a person.

keyMoments.title: Rescues Kokoro, Chimney, and Chopper
keyMoments.description: Sanji emerges from the wreckage of the destroyed escape ship, having saved Kokoro, Chimney, and Chopper from the explosion.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Sanji's protective nature and quick reflexes in crisis situations.

keyMoments.title: Completely Immobilized After Battle
keyMoments.description: Following his intense battle with Rob Lucci, Luffy is completely unable to move and must be protected and carried by his crew.
keyMoments.significance: Shows the physical toll of fighting one of the strongest CP9 agents and creates a role reversal where Luffy must be protected.
